Description:
SOCIALENERGY Project

Competency Framework 03 - LAST NEW

Based on the European Qualification Framework

EQF-based competence framework for SOCIALENERGY

The following competence framework is used in SocialEnergy platform. It includes 7 base competencies, each one divided into three levels of proficiency. The user competence profile, stored at the GSRN platform, includes 7 values (each one corresponding to the level of proficiency of the respected competence). Value 1 indicates Basic (Level 1) of proficiency, value 2 indicates Intermediate (Level 2) of proficiency, and value 3 indicates Expert (Level 3) of proficiency for each of the seven competencies.

Short name: 1.1. Energy efficient electric appliances. Level 1 - Basic
Description:
1. Knowledge
    Knows the main types of mostly used appliances, presented in the market.
  2. Skills
    Can operate main types of mostly used appliances, presented in the market.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Applies autonomously and with responsibility knowledge and skills for the main types of mostly used appliances, presented in the market.

Short name: 1.2. Energy efficient electric appliances. Level 2 - Intermediate
Description:
1. Knowledge
    Knows the usage of energy per electric appliance.
  2. Skills
    Uses safely electrical equipment and power grid.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Makes autonomously and with responsibility a safe use of electrical equipment and power grid.

Short name: 1.3. Energy efficient electric appliances. Level 3 - Expert
Description:
1. Knowledge
    Knows the benefits of more energy efficient appliances.
  2. Skills
    Understands and performs activities leading to energy savings.
  3. Responsibilities and autonomy
    Develops habits for responsible and autonomous efficient energy consumption.

1. Knowledge
    Has some initial information that such labels are used.
  2. Skills
    Can find if some labelling information is included for a given appliance.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Has some understanding that this issue is important.

1. Knowledge
    Knows the EU energy labelling (the rationale of energy labelling of electric devices and houses/buildings).
  2. Skills
    Recognises the EU energy labels.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Makes informed judgement about the energy efficiency of an appliance on the base of its EU label.

1. Knowledge
    Can assign labels to appliances even if such information is not provided.
  2. Skills
    Can apply knowledge about energy labels in various situations.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Can inform others about any information related to energy labelling.

1. Knowledge
    Knows basic energy metrics.
  2. Skills
    Recognises and decodes basic energy metrics.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Applies autonomously basic energy metrics' knowledge and skills to take basic energy efficient decisions.

1. Knowledge
    Knows energy metrics for energy efficiency.
  2. Skills
    Recognises and decodes energy metrics for energy efficiency.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Applies autonomously energy efficient metrics knowledge and skills to take efficient decisions.

1. Knowledge
    Knows energy metrics for Demand Response (DR).
  2. Skills
    Decodes the important data and information for DR, included in documented energy feedback messages.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Applies autonomously energy metrics knowledge and skills for DR, to take energy efficient decisions.

1. Knowledge
    Knows what is DR.
  2. Skills
    Avoids simultaneous usage of appliances. Reduces electricity consumption at the house level and on per electric appliance level (i.e. load curtailment / shedding).
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Takes responsible decisions for participation in DR.

1. Knowledge
    Knows how to shift jobs from peak hours to non-peak hours (i.e. load shifting).
  2. Skills
    Shifts jobs from peak hours to non-peak hours (i.e. load shifting).
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Takes responsible decisions about reducing electricity consumption.

1. Knowledge
    Knows the consequences of participation in DR
  2. Skills
    Reacts appropriately to DR messages. Possesses the trade-off skills to balance between energy (bill) cost and discomfort (i.e. lower electricity bill incurs some acceptable level of discomfort).
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Possesses knowledge and skills to participate autonomously in DR events/activities.

1. Knowledge
    Basic concept of smart grid. How does the electricity market work?
  2. Skills
    Identifies types of electricity market, including smart grid types.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Takes responsible actions for selection and joining particular type of electricity market.

1. Knowledge
    Knows what energy prosumer is. Knows the basics of EU liberalised electricity markets.
  2. Skills
    Makes informed choices in the context of the EU liberalised electricity markets.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Acts as a responsible energy consumer / prosumer. Makes responsible autonomous choices for participation of the EU liberalised electricity market.

1. Knowledge
    Knows the environmental impact of energy efficiency. Knows how to identify the products minimum description related to kWh/CO2 information.
  2. Skills
    Uses the products minimum description related to kWh/CO2 information.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Assess autonomously the environmental impact of energy efficiency.

Short name: 6.1. Types of pricing schemes and energy programs. Level 1 - Basic
Description:
1. Knowledge
    Knows major energy programs: Traditional flat electricity tariff, Inclining Block Rates (IBR) pricing.
  2. Skills
    Can use the following pricing schemes: Traditional flat electricity tariff, Inclining Block Rates (IBR) pricing.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    In a given context, makes responsible and autonomous choice between the following pricing schemes: Traditional flat electricity tariff; Inclining Block Rates (IBR) pricing.

Short name: 6.2. Types of pricing schemes and energy programs. Level 2 - Intermediate
Description:
1. Knowledge
    Knows major energy programs: Time-of-Use (ToU) electricity pricing; Real-Time Pricing (RTP).
  2. Skills
    Can use the following pricing schemes: Time-of-Use (ToU) electricity pricing; Real-Time Pricing (RTP).
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    In a given context, makes responsible and autonomous choice between the following pricing schemes: Time-of-Use (ToU) electricity pricing; Real-Time Pricing (RTP).

Short name: 6.3. Types of pricing schemes and energy programs. Level 3 - Expert
Description:
1. Knowledge
    Knows major energy programs: Personalized RTP; Community RTP.
  2. Skills
    Can use the following pricing schemes: Personalised RTP; Community RTP.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    In a given context, makes responsible and autonomous choice between the following pricing schemes: Personalized RTP; Community RTP.

1. Knowledge
    Knows what are Energy Communities.
  2. Skills
    Has skills to participate in energy communities.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Makes responsible and autonomous decisions about participation in energy communities.

1. Knowledge
    Knows how to form an energy community.
  2. Skills
    Has skills to form energy communities.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Makes responsible and autonomous decisions about participation in energy communities.

1. Knowledge
    Knows how to manage an energy community.
  2. Skills
    Has skills to manage energy communities.
  3. Responsibility and autonomy
    Makes responsible and autonomous decisions in managing energy communities.
